article.para: These are the release notes for the DocBook Slides package. At a minimum, this file attempts to document changes to the public APIs and provide a high-level overview of the features added in each release.

section.title: Release 3.4.0
section.para: This is a feature release that also contains fixes for a few bugs. The main feature changes arenewly added support for generating presentations in HTML Help, Keynote, and SVG formats. See the file for a complete list of changes made since the previous release. The following is a summary of the user-visible changes.

listitem.simpara: Added attribute-set to easily control appearance of footer
Added support for foil/subtitle. Bookmarks in XEP can contain i18n characters.
Changed attribute namespaces accordingly to new schema used for titlepage templates.
xref to foil and foilgroup is now supported. (You must have the DocBook XSL stylesheets v1.67.0 or greater to use xrefs.)
Added new parameter show.foil.number which can enable numbering of slides. Currently works only with frames.xsl and multiframe=0.
Slides can now be generated in HTML Help format.
Slides can now be generated in Keynote format.

note.simpara: There is not yet any user documentation describing how to use the Keynote stylesheet.

listitem.simpara: Slides can now be generated using SVG.

note.simpara: The SVG stylesheet is still a bit rough and not yet documented; users are encouraged to try it and post comments to docbook-apps
